positive.heading: Buy Health Insurance
positive.description: The cheapest plan on the Massachusetts health care exchange is the bronze plan, which costs $180/month and covers basic things like doctor visits, home visits, ambulatory care, hospitalization, vision exams, and hearing exams.
positive.outcome: Good choice! David can get preventative care, like vaccinations, for free. And in case anything unexpected happens, David can get affordable access to the care he needs.
positive.alternative: But what if he had opted to pay the tax instead?

negative.heading: Pay Tax, No Coverage
negative.description: David is healthy, so why buy insurance? The penalty is the greater of 2% of income or $325 (or $27/month).
negative.outcome: At the time, David thought opting out was the more affordable and better option. Unfortunately, your health is not something you can control.

positive.heading: Use Telemedicine
positive.description: David can use his smartphone to video chat with a doctor.
positive.outcome: Good choice! The doctor prescribed antiviral therapy and David was back to normal within a week.
positive.alternative: But what if he did not have access to telemedicine services?

negative.heading: Get Some Rest
negative.description: David has some soup and lies down for a nap. Maybe the symptoms will resolve on their own.
negative.outcome: When David woke up, his symptoms were worse.

positive.heading: Of Course!
positive.description: Electronic health records make it easy for doctors to access a patient’s medical information.
positive.outcome: The doctor saw that David was previously diagnosed with an arrhythmia, so the doctor decided the abnormal cardiac activity was probably not related to the flu. David was sent home with an antiviral regimen and was back to normal within a week.
positive.alternative: But what if the doctor didn’t have access?

negative.heading: No
negative.description: Even though David’s previous doctor used an electronic health record, it was a different system than this emergency department uses. Since the systems do not communicate with each other, the doctor does not have instant access to David’s medical information.
negative.outcome: The doctor did not know David had previously been diagnosed with an arrhythmia.
